title: Are judges still a check on Trump's power?
summary: With opponents to Trump turning to the judiciary to block some of his actions, Americans are realizing that the courts have no means of enforcing their decisions if the executive branch chooses not to comply.

title: US plans to hold Ukraine peace talks without Europeans
summary: After the Munich Security Conference, which highlighted the rift that now separates the US from the EU, the Elysée is set to convene a European summit on Monday. The Ukrainian president has said Moscow plans to create 15 new armed divisions this year.

title: European countries to meet in Paris on Monday to discuss security
summary: President Emmanuel Macron 'will bring together the main European countries tomorrow for discussions on European security,' said France's foreign minister.

title: Bird flu: As the epidemic worsens, the US will import eggs from Turkey
summary: Over three years, the spread of the H5N1 virus has forced American farms to cull 158 million turkeys, chickens and, above all, laying hens.

title: 'Conclave' and 'Brutalist' win BAFTA with four awards each
summary: Scandal-hit 'Emilia Perez,' had been heavily favoured at the beginning of the year. But it only emerged with two BAFTAs, including one for Zoe Saldana for best supporting actress.

title: LeBron James, injured, withdraws from All-Star Game
summary: James, making his 21st appearance in the All-Star game, had been due to play for 'Team Shaq' selected by Shaquille O'Neal, alongside stars such as Stephen Curry, Kevin Durant, Damian Lillard and Jayson Tatum.

title: Germany: Thousands march against far right in Berlin
summary: At least 30,000 people demonstrated in Berlin a week ahead of the elections and after comments by US Vice President JD Vance calling for German political parties to abandon the 'firewall' policy of not working with the far right.

title: Navalny supporters mark anniversary of death with memorial events
summary: Hundreds risked reprisals by visiting Alexei Navalny's death in Moscow. His widow Yulia Navalnaya called Russians abroad to protest 'for those people in Russia who can't.'

title: Concerns over Ukrainian cybersecurity after USAID funding freeze
summary: The American agency funded an entire ecosystem that bolstered Kyiv's telecommunications networks against Russian cyberattacks. It also subsidized Starlink terminals, which were at the center of an internal audit over allegations of 'theft' and 'corruption.'

title: US diplomat Rubio and Israeli leader Netanyahu present a united front against Hamas and Iran
summary: Israeli security cabinet will discuss on Monday the new phase of the Gaza truce after the US State Secretary Marco Rubio's visit.

title: Victor Wembanyama hopes to shine at NBA All-Star Game
summary: Selected for his first All-Star Game on Sunday, the 21-year-old Frenchman warned that he was in San Francisco to win. But LeBron James and Stephen Curry could stand in his way.

title: Pia Bailleul, anthropologist: 'Greenlanders are not afraid of Donald Trump'
summary: The researcher, a specialist in mining anthropology and the Arctic, explains how Greenland intends to make use of the US president's interest in its natural resources, and capitalize on it in the geopolitical arena.

title: In Brazil, Lula's popularity plummets
summary: Halfway through his term, the left-wing president is not only paying the price for  inflation, but also suffering the physical wear-and-tear of leadership.

title: 'The French right and far right use Algeria to reinforce their rejection of immigration'
summary: The French right and far right exploit a form of 'historical income,' just as much as the Algerian regime, which uses it to fuel its own nationalism and silence its opponents, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: DRC: Rwanda-backed rebels seize key city of Bukavu
summary: AS M23 fighters took hold of the capital of South Kivu province, the African Union warned of a 'balkanization of eastern DRC.'

title: Camille Claudel bronze sculpture sold for €3.1 million at auction
summary: The bronze sculpture by French artist Camille Claudel, depicting a scene thought to evoke her separation with fellow artist Auguste Rodin, was found by chance in a flat that had been uninhabited for 15 years.

title: Trump says he could meet Putin'very soon' ahead of Riyadh talks on ending war in Ukraine
summary: The US President added that he believes his Russian counterpart genuinely wants to stop fighting in Ukraine. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Sunday he was ready to send troops to Ukraine if it was needed to ensure the security of Britain and Europe.

title: Introducing M International: The best of Le Monde's M magazine, now in English
summary: From March on, the best of M Le magazine du Monde will be available online, in a biannual print edition and twice a month as a newsletter.

title: Should traditional sea urchin fishing be banned in Corsica to save the species?
summary: Harvesting is subject to quotas and permitted only from February 15 to April 15 on the French Mediterranean island. Given the increasing scarcity, a moratorium is under discussion.
